title: What topics should computer science education include? - Quora
tags: Career Advice and Computer Science Education

response.answer_text: Computer Science is a combination of math skills (Discrete Math), understating the limits and ability of human cognition (ie Experimental Psychology and linguistics), theory of computation (Turing’s theorems), Automata Theory (also Turning), algorithms, data structures, operating systems principles, programming languages, and programming skills. For a authoritative list see the ACM (Association of Computing Machines) at Curricula Recommendations I have a degree in Computer Science, you might look at https://www.acm.org/binaries/content/assets/education/cs2013_web_final.pdf first.

Computer science education is really a history course. You primarily learn how previous other engineers solved common problems and why they chose the solutions. The rest is about math, algorithms and theory.
